message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IR, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.SE 

This paper is primarily focused on the security aspects of IoT devices and proposes a practical Host-based Anomaly Detection System for IoT (HADES-IoT). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). 

The paper also discusses the deployment of HADES-IoT on Linux-based IoT devices, which falls under the sub-category of cs.SY (Systems and Control). 

The evaluation of HADES-IoT's effectiveness and performance overhead involves experiments and data analysis, which can be categorized under cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.SE (Software Engineering). 

Finally, the paper also discusses the challenges and concerns related to the security of IoT devices, which falls under the sub-category of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture).
